result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Ernest Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew Ernest Jones in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This case is being heard for Branch 24. 
  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read in as to sentencing on case 15cm1670
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed office contact (2).

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Matthew Ernest Jones not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a new case pending.  Defense would like an adjournment to work on a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Violation Report submitted due to missed office contact.

Defendant Matthew Ernest Jones in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Matthew Ernest Jones in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Matthew Ernest Jones in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
